intro: Discretitheca nepalensis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the Nepal thyme or small-leaved discretitheca, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, characterized by its square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing adaptability to high-altitude conditions. Its small, fragrant flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in summer. The leaves are narrow, hairy, and emit a subtle mint-like scent when crushed.
